post_text:
The Lamoni PTO is selling stadium seats. All proceeds will go to the PTO to support our local students and teachers! Seats are available in 2 sizes, with 2 designs to choose from. See photo for designs, sizes, and prices.

Orders must be placed and paid for by March 1st. To place your order, contact Shyra Ogier. Orders will be accepted via facebook messenger, email, or in person. Thanks so much for your support!

Update: There are a only a few ornaments left on the giving trees!! Thanks so much to everyone that has already purchased gifts for the teachers! If you would still like to get in on the fun, you can stop by the elementary or the HS commons and choose a teacher to buy for!! Trees will be up until tomorrow afternoon!

The PTO is excited to announce that the Teacher Giving Trees are all set up and ready to go!!If you are interested in giving a teacher a gift from his/her wish list, please stop by the school and choose an ornament from one of the trees! The ornaments on the trees are labeled with a teacher‚Äôs name and an item that they need for their classroom. Please choose an ornament from the tree, purchase the item listed on the back, and deliver it to the teacher before winter break. There is a tree for elementary teachers located next to the office in the elementary building and a tree for middle school and high school teachers in the high school commons area. (Specials teachers are included on both trees). The trees will be up until winter break. Happy Holidays!

The trees will be up until winter break. Happy Holidays!

post_text: Thank you so much to Pizza Shack for helping Lamoni PTO provide pizza for teachers and staff during parent teacher conferences! Being able to provide a meal during this busy week is just one of the ways that we like to show our appreciation for all that the teachers and staff do for our students and community!
text: Thank you so much to Pizza Shack for helping Lamoni PTO provide pizza for teachers and staff during parent teacher conferences! Being able to provide a meal during this busy week is just one of the ways that we like to show our appreciation for all that the teachers and staff do for our students and community!

post_text: Next week is Parent Teacher Conference week, which means that our teachers will be putting in long days meeting with parents to discuss student progress and show off all of the awesome things that our kids have been doing! The PTO would like to show our teachers and staff just how much we appreciate their time and energy by providing them with food on conference night. If you would like to help out with this, please drop off fruit, veggies, or pre-packaged desserts at either of the main offices on Monday, October 30th and/or Thursday, November 2nd! Thanks for your help! :)
text: Next week is Parent Teacher Conference week, which means that our teachers will be putting in long days meeting with parents to discuss student progress and show off all of the awesome things that our kids have been doing! The PTO would like to show our teachers and staff just how much we appreciate their time and energy by providing them with food on conference night. If you would like to help out with this, please drop off fruit, veggies, or pre-packaged desserts at either of the main offices on Monday, October 30th and/or Thursday, November 2nd! Thanks for your help! :)

Chad Elliott, international award winning songwriter and author, will be at Lamoni Community Schools on February 27 presenting workshops for all students. post_text:
The Giving Tree

*There are still several ornaments available!!

If you would like to give a gift to a teacher this holiday season please take a moment and visit ‚ÄúThe Giving Tree‚Äù . Just stop by and choose an ornament, purchase that item, and return to the teacher before Christmas Break. A tree for the elementary teachers is located next to the office in the elementary building. We also have a tree for middle school and high school teachers located by the concession area in the high school commons. These ornaments contain items that these teachers have specified as a need in their particular class room or area. We appreciate your taking the time to pick an ornament. The trees will be up until the week of Christmas Break.

Fundraiser!!

The Lamoni PTO is currently selling Lamoni Demons stadium seats. Cost per seat is $55 with an option of a red or black seat with an image (see photo).

post_text:
Make a Difference in your Teachers Classroom this Christmas Season!
If you are a parent that likes to help out and you were thinking of giving a gift to your child‚Äôs teacher this Christmas please stop by the elementary school and get an ornament from the ‚ÄúGiving Tree‚Äù. The PTO have asked the elementary teachers this year what they need in their class rooms and each ornament is adorned with the teachers name and an item. Simply pick-out an ornament, shop, and return that item to the teacher listed on the tag. As parents, I don‚Äôt think we realize the expense that comes out of a teacher‚Äôs own paycheck. We have an opportunity to make a difference and contribute in a meaningful way to our school. So please stop by and get an ornament to support our school and its staff if you can this holiday season.
text:
Make a Difference in your Teachers Classroom this Christmas Season!
If you are a parent that likes to help out and you were thinking of giving a gift to your child‚Äôs teacher this Christmas please stop by the elementary school and get an ornament from the ‚ÄúGiving Tree‚Äù. The PTO have asked the elementary teachers this year what they need in their class rooms and each ornament is adorned with the teachers name and an item. Simply pick-out an ornament, shop, and return that item to the teacher listed on the tag. As parents, I don‚Äôt think we realize the expense that comes out of a teacher‚Äôs own paycheck. We have an opportunity to make a difference and contribute in a meaningful way to our school. So please stop by and get an ornament to support our school and its staff if you can this holiday season.

post_text: Points from our Labels for Education Program were able to be redeemed to support a variety of areas in our school that are in need. Check out the pictures below to see where our points are going. Keep clipping!
text: Points from our Labels for Education Program were able to be redeemed to support a variety of areas in our school that are in need. Check out the pictures below to see where our points are going. Keep clipping!

post_text: The middle school celebrated with Halloween decorated donuts and juice inspired by Mrs. Carpenter‚Äôs creativity. 6B collected the most Labels for Education and Box Tops to kick off the first competition in the middle school this year. They will get to choose what the prize will be for next contest. Thank you to all that participate. The school has been the recipient of many useful items the money and points from these programs provide. The committee would also like to thank the business‚Äôs that have donated to the program throughout the years so that we can provide these kids with the fun activities/food.
text: The middle school celebrated with Halloween decorated donuts and juice inspired by Mrs. Carpenter‚Äôs creativity. 6B collected the most Labels for Education and Box Tops to kick off the first competition in the middle school this year. They will get to choose what the prize will be for next contest. Thank you to all that participate. The school has been the recipient of many useful items the money and points from these programs provide. The committee would also like to thank the business‚Äôs that have donated to the program throughout the years so that we can provide these kids with the fun activities/food.

post_text:
Mrs. Burke‚Äôs 2nd Grade won the ‚ÄúWho Collected The Most BoxTops/Labels Over The Summer‚Äù competition. They were able to celebrate with an ice cream sundae party. Students were treated to vanilla soft serve ice cream and several toppings. Thank you to Pierce‚Äôs Dairy Cup for donating the ice cream for this great party!!

The next competition is for the GRADE (pre-K through 5th) that collects the most box tops and labels for education. The prize will be a subway party platter that has been donated by Subway. Thank you to all the great business‚Äôs that support this program. Our school has been able to benefit from the funds and points with many great items over the years.
